Articles.Content:
Hey guys I'm back here once again!

I have this idea and just want some opinions on it if you wouldn't mind. I am thinking about doing a mini series on the history of space flight (US and USSR) up until modern day. Going and doing research from the very beginning and going into as much detail as I can find on a certain time period and making a video about to try and educate the people.

What do you guys think?

Yes, if the production quality is documentary-level

No if it's a Movie Maker video with a static-y microphone narration that sounds like a 12-year old.

Not movie maker editing, and not the best mic but it also isn't too crappy, its not filled with static. Being 16, almost 17, I doubt I sound like a 12 year old lol.

But seriouslly I love the history of space flight with the human race and would love to educate myself by doing research for this project and educate others at the same time.

This is an example of the quality i'm talking about when I mean documentary-style. He released it on the forums a long time ago. It an amateur thing, but it's really good for not being a professional outfit:

Alright so I watched that and I must say I did learn several things I did not know about Hubble.

Also I think if I work at it I can get something to close to this quality. I just need a few pointers on a few things.
